intro: Clinelymus glaucus subsp. californicus, commonly known as the California jointweed, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Clinelymus glaucus subsp. californicus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in arid environments.
